title: The Djinn Crisis
description:
Edited recaps from a actual-play D&D campaign. This campaign follows several groups who exist concurrently in the same world, and whose actions are seen by each other. 

Listen to my players as they attempt to stymie forces both within and far beyond their control or comprehension. Will they save the world, or damn it? Will they be able to work together, or find each other's company untenable? Most worriesome of all, does this overarching story plagiarize almost every great fantasy fiction ever to have been written?

description: Welcome to The Rise, the world's newest gaming podcast where we examine the world of gaming and content creation from the perspective of a group of young content creators, who are "on the rise" in the gaming content creation industry. Prepare for open, honest, and raw commentary on the world of gaming and the greater universe that surrounds it!

description:
Hello Meeples! We're a couple (literally) of board gamers that love the hobby so much we decided to just...start talking about it. Russell and Jennifer--that's us--have been a part of multiple gaming groups, drawn in our family, and hooked our kids on board gaming for the last 20 years.

Need more talk about your favorite obsession? Hearing dice in your sleep? Daydreaming about that next gaming group session? 

Let us help take the edge off! We talk about EVERYTHING: specific games, groups of games, themes of games, gaming sessions. All. Of. It.

Come join us for some dice-rolling, victory-point earning, miniature-moving conversation!

description:
A tabletop roleplaying game (TTRPG) talk show hosted by animator and musician: Cool Boy Shane!

Check us out on youtube for the entire backlog (and more)!
https://www.youtube.com/c/CoolBoyShane

Podcasts & Players is a podcast that aims to entertain with stories and tips for roleplaying games like D&D, as well as to promote content creators who love playing them. 

Each episode begins with a general interview about the guest, and then we segue into nerdy topics like character creation, stories from our D&D and Pathfinder games, numbers and game mechanics, tips for dungeon masters and story tellers, setting expectations, world building, running combats, our favorite classes and homebrew, and much, much more!

Guests include a variety of content creators in the TTRPG space on Youtube and beyond! Big names and small ones alike, the core factor that ties us all together is our love for rolling dice, drawing cards, and getting into character for games atop tables (and online)!

title: My Life In Miniatures
description:
Each week, I talk to a different guest about the miniatures that have inspired them throughout their life. From the first toy soldier they ever picked up, to their most current projects, and plenty of amazing things in between. This podcast is intended to accompany you as you sit down to hobby yourself, and provide a glimpse into the histories of gamers and painters, new and old. 

My name is John and I've been running the hobby blog heresyandheroes.com for almost a decade now, and I've met so many amazing painters and gamers, that I thought I'd try putting together a podcast where I can introduce you to these talented individuals and get into why they love the hobby, and what keeps them going. There's a page on the blog featuring more details on each guest, and I'll be running seasons of 10-12 episodes with short breaks between seasons. 

You can follow me on twitter at @Heresyheroes to keep up with the latest news about the show, and I encourage you to follow each of my guests too.

title: Arctis: A Homebrew D&D Liveplay
description: Welcome to Arctis - A high fantasy Dungeons and Dragons world set in a magical polar region filled with adventure! The mystical aurora borealis serves as a guiding light for the continent's mysterious inhabitants. Storied heroes can Ascend to a higher plane, becoming revered wardens of the land. Will you protect Arctis, or corrupt it from within? Arctis is a persistent campaign played with D&D 5th edition rules on Foundry Virtual Tabletop. Our players are video game industry professionals, designers, and content creators with decades of experience who want to kick back and roll some dice with friends.

title: The Esports Report
description:
The Esports Report is a podcast focusing on American High School Esports programs. The hosts, Ashley Hodge and Wil Nix, both started as Season 0 Esports coaches through the PlayVS Georgia Esports program. Wil Nix has experienced significant success with his program by winning the Georgia State Championship for Rocket League, and he serves on the GHSA Esports Board of Advisors. Ashley Hodge serves as a PlayVS Supercoach, A member of the GHSA Esports Board of Advisors, and a member of Riot’s Scholastic Association of America. She has created two successful esports programs in Georgia. Additionally, she is currently working on a esports dissertation. 


The goal of this podcast is to educate admins, students, parents, schools, and society about esports in American high schools. Topics include the following: a history of esports in GA, how to start a program, how to fund a program, how to coach, how to manage social media accounts, how to grow your program, and much more. Furthermore, several interviews with GHSA, PlayVS, coaches, students, and players are planned for future episodes. 

Please engage with us by leaving comments on the Youtube episodes, rating and reviewing us on Apple Podcast, and emailing us at theesportsreporths@gmail.com 

If you are a business or potential sponsor, we would love to do promotions for you. Your contribution will help cover the cost of editing software used and other expenses to make this show possible. Please contact us for ad rates at our email listed above. 

We hope you enjoy the show!

title: Two Gays and a Digimon Podcast
description:
Welcome to the newest podcast in the Digital World! Join Digidestined, Michael and Adam as they walk through the Digimon franchise! Adam is a life long fan and is introducing his boyfriend Michael to his favorite franchise ever. 

This podcast is obviously hosted by two queer identifying people, we will not be discussing any explicit content as Digimon is meant for children, but we are two adults who are are sometimes going to say grown up things. We will not be diving into the more, explicit, aspects of the Digimon fan community, but we may occasionally bring up more adult topics, if you are or know of any young people who are interested in listening to our podcast please be cautioned that we may discuss more uncomfortable topics or topics that may be deemed inappropriate for younger listeners. We will be issuing warnings as the episodes are posted. 

We do not tolerate any hate comments left on our social media, we are in support of progressive social movements and will occasionally highlight and touch on these topics to a degree deemed appropriate by us. If these kind of topics bother you, please refrain from commenting on our content. 

We are beyond excited to begin this journey with anyone who will listen! We welcome all, fans old and new! Come listen to our show!

title: Dusk//Dawn
description:
Josh and Alex (whose internet pseudonyms are Karif_Wins and dRafterDemon respectively) have been drafting Magic: The Gathering for many years now, listening to other podcasts and gaining skills through osmosis. Now, they want to improve their skills by creating a podcast that deep dives weekly into competitive Limited gameplay while also acknowledging the hilarity of the MTG grind. 

Dusk//Dawn is a conversational podcast which leverages both Josh and Alex's obsessions to continually explore the inner workings of modern limited Magic. As a secondary goal, it's also self-aware of the fact that the hosts still don't have perfect knowledge of how to play the game. Strategy, commentary, game design criticisms, bad heuristics, and comedy are all fair game while talking. For those obsessed with Magic commentary like Josh and Alex, Dusk//Dawn is the chaser for the more analytical and technical Magic podcasts about Limited.

Explicit Content -- Swearing
Intro and outro song courtesy of the Free Music Archive
Jesse Spillane - Sinking Feeling

title: A Pint Of Cthulhu
description:
Hello and welcome to A Pint Of Cthulhu We are a group of six friends from various corners of the world - two Americans, two Scottish, and two English - and we love nothing more than playing tabletop role-playing games (TTRPGs) together.

But this is not your typical TTRPG experiment, serious and compliant with the rules. Oh no. Our sessions are filled with laughter, jokes and plenty of messing about. We don't get too serious, and we're not afraid to get drunk every once in a while.

Each season, we'll be taking you on a journey through a different TTRPG. From Dungeons & Dragons to Call of Cthulhu and many more each season, we're always up for trying something new. And along the way, we'll be sharing our thoughts, experiences, and of course, plenty of laughs.

So sit down, chill out, and join us for a little TTRPG fun. You never know what will happen, but one thing is for sure - it's always a great time with our group.

title: Subject Matter: Table Top
description:
From the dungeons of Gloomhaven and the battlefields of Root, to the shores of Catan and the rails of Ticket to Ride, popular board games couch complex subjects within richly thematic gameplay. Millions of people find joy in the experiences that these games create, but what else do we get from playing them? 

In this podcast, Steve Gotzler and Jordan Tynes explore the world of tabletop games with people who possess a deep understanding of the various themes, settings, systems, or content that we encounter in them. What does an economist think about while playing Monopoly? What about a quilter sitting down for a round of Patchwork? A planetary geologist and Terraforming Mars? Or a farmer and Agricola? 

Steve, Jordan, and their guests consider how games communicate information about the variety of subjects they take up. They also ask how games can influence players’ feelings about each other, and the world that they inhabit. From the physical components strewn about the table, to the rules we share while playing, sit down for a round of playful discussion about the cultural relevance of tabletop gaming.

Fantasy Pants aims to bring a new level of immersion to the Dungeons & Dragons RPG actual play podcast experience. Blending narrative storytelling with the authenticity and antics of three close friends, fun and consequence are faced in equal measure. Dungeon Master and evil genius David tells a captivating story with his distinctive style of homebrew, Jeremy edits and writes unique music for the show, and socialite Stephen loves keeping in touch with YOU on social media @fantasypantspod. Be welcome and join us at our table every Monday for a wild ride!

Now Playing: DnD - Journeys Through The Radiant Citadel

We use terms and comparisons from WoW to relate to fantasy football in funny, yet applicable ways.

title: That's No Moon: A Star Wars Legion Podcast
description:
That's No Moon: A Star Wars Legion Podcast.

A UK & European Star Wars Legion Podcast. Expect unit reviews, battle reports and general Star Wars Legion chit chat from a UK and European perspective. 

That’s No Moon features three of the UK’s most known players in the UK Star Wars Legion scene.

Andy Terrell, also known as AJST on discord is “pundit” number one. As current UK champion, tournament organiser and once described as the UK’s version of LJ Pena, what this man doesn’t know about Legion isn’t worth knowing. Expect expert tactical advice and insightful takes as this man will help you level up your game.

Our second commentator is Olly Dier (CBT3 on discord), another man well known in the UK scene and is usually found in the top cuts at major events most recently with an obscene OP Luke with Rebel DLT troopers in support.

Lastly the unenviable task hosting and keeping the show on track is Cockles Faulkner (aka CocklesFaulkner on discord). Cockles will often be found at UK legion events, admittedly more southern based events but when he is not playing Legion he can often be found in a Karaoke bar or sat at home still dreaming of knowing what a top cut is.

You may wish to contact us and can do so by emailing Thatsnomoonpod@googlemail.com

You can also follow us on Instagram @thatsnomoonpodcast or like our Facebook Page “That’s No Moon: A Star Wars Legion Podcast”.

We look forward to hearing from you and providing you with some great SWL content!
May the force be with us! (It’s going to be needed)

title: Higher Education: A 5e Strixhaven AP
description: Strixhaven University is known for its illustrious undergraduate program -- but what about its grad students? HIGHER EDUCATION is an explosive dark academia campaign that follows five brilliant, jaded, and caffeine-fueled grad students on the verge of burning out. The Cycle of Ascension is coming -- a magical phenomenon by which mortals can become gods -- and each student has their own reason for wanting to ascend... or not. Either way, Arcavios beckons! Can our heroes wrangle their conflicting ideals about godhood, their obligations, and their graduate thesis? Or will the very real threats lurking in the halls of Strixhaven consume them all?

title: Hard Knocks Sorority
description: Welcome to the Hard Knocks Sorority PodCast, a Shadowrun 4th Edition Actual Play Podcast. My name is Paul, and I am your host and GM. Get in touch with us on our Discord server https://discord.gg/2rg6yyHeHF . The Player Characters are given voice and agency by Veronika playing Cecile, Aka "College Girl" a literal college girl who finds herself abruptly entangled with the 6th world's shadows. Elizabeth playing Grace aka "Nightingale" a literal pony on a quixotic self-imposed research expedition to the 6th World. Valerie playing Ali aka "Boxer", ex-merc and literal Cat woman who now plys the shadows in search of redemption. And finally Kat playing "Diendre" an elven ex-cop who is in search of her brother in Seattle and is literally prettier than an elf has any right to be. Follow along as we muddle our way through the Shadowrun 4th Edition rules. We would love to hear from you on Discord. Intro and Outro (?) music by Tracemineral.

title: Gals & Goblins
description:
Gals & Goblins is an adventure podcast that loosely follows the rules of Dungeons & Dragons and strictly follows the Rule of Cool. This podcast aims to cultivate joy and camaraderie through play. We use performance as a stepping stone to build community with our audience and provide them actionable ways to create their own adventuring party. We are part of the movement to tell anyone who may have been previously excluded from the TTRPG community: We belong here, and so do you.

Join Campbell, Lilly, Maddy, Olivia, and Jared as they traverse the realm of Eldrivale and make their way to Frogmont Adventuring Academy for Young Women! We don’t know exactly what the future holds, but we can assure you there will be shenanigans and friendship galore!

title: Dungeon Dreamers
description:
Welcome to Dungeon Dreamers, an actual-play D&D podcast with a mix of comedy and heartfelt role-play! Join us as we explore a variety of unique worlds and characters, each with their own stories to tell!

On our first adventure, we find ourselves in the world of Fleur, a land with vast, open seas and Ambitious people raring to rule them. By some turn of fate, a band of rookie (and not-so-rookie) pirates meet, traversing the seas in search of change.

title: niedoGRAni
description:
Witajcie strudzeni wędrowcy!

Weźcie kufle w dłoń i przystańcie na chwile, by posłuchać pewnej historii:

Nikt na nich nie czekał, a oni i tak nadeszli...

Mówili później, że nadeszli tęczową drogą w towarzystwie podejrzanie wyglądającej grupy centaurów dzierżąc w jednej dłoni różdżkę, w drugiej zaś pada. Twarze ich osłonięte były kapturami, zaś u pasa zwisał miecz świetlny - elegancka broń, na bardziej cywilizowane czasy.

Nikt nie wie, skąd przybyli, ani dokąd zmierzają. Wiadomo jednak, iż byli absolutnie niedoGRAni!

Witamy Was w naszym programie, gdzie będziemy dzielić się z Wami naszymi spostrzeżeniami i doświadczeniami ze świata gamingu i szeroko pojętej popkultury. Rozsiądźcie się wygodnie i... do usłyszenia!

Aga i Michał

title: Gaming_for_insight
description:
Gaming_for_insight provides the following content: weekly gaming updates; its monthly show, Last Month In Gaming; and, segments on gaming handhelds (e.g., ASUS ROG Ally) including the segment Which Handheld Plays It Better.

Weekly gaming updates are brief and cover up to five significant updates that occurred the week prior. Monthly episodes of Last Month In Gaming include Joe, the Panel, and perhaps a special guest that team up to show you what games released the month prior.

Handheld content extend to hardware installs and software adjustments. The segment Which Handheld Plays It Better covers a game (e.g., Skyrim) played across two to three handhelds using certain settings (e.g., APU TDB, Texture settings, VRAM Allocation, FSR).

The channel name, Gaming_for_insight, was inspired by the game, Bloodborne. One plays the game to gain insight and as the player gains insight he or she discovers more about Yharnam just your host Joe gains insight with gaming.

description:

Në këtë podcast, do të të sjellim lajmet më të reja në botën e gaming-ut, duke fokusuar veçanërisht në ekipet tona të lojërave të preferuara. Bashkë me mysafirët tanë të veçantë, do të diskutojmë sfidat dhe sukseset e industrisë së esports.

title: APS Pod of Greed
description: The Pod of Greed is a weekly podcast that's all about the world of card games, hosted by Paul and Alec from the popular YouTube channel Team APS. If you're a fan of Yu-Gi-Oh, Pokémon, Magic: The Gathering, or any other trading card game, then this is the podcast for you! Each episode, Paul and Alec dive into the latest news and trends in the world of card games, and share their personal experiences and insights on the games they love. But it's not just all about cards - they also chat about gaming, anime, and other pop culture topics that are relevant to the card game community. With a fun and casual approach to their discussions, Paul and Alec make the Pod of Greed an entertaining and informative listen for anyone who's passionate about card games. Whether you're a seasoned pro or just getting started in the hobby, you're sure to find something to enjoy in each episode of the Pod of Greed!

Discover the power of gaming communities and the impact they have on gamers worldwide. We'll explore the vibrant online platforms, popular forums, and social media groups where gamers connect and share their passion for gaming.

From eSports and competitive gaming to retro classics and everything in between, we leave no stone unturned. Our conversations will delve into the fascinating world of gaming influencers and streamers, discussing their influence on the industry and the rise of professional gaming.

"The Its Doh Show" also explores the relationship between gaming and mental health, highlighting the positive aspects of gaming as a stress-reliever while addressing potential challenges like addiction and promoting healthy gaming habits.

Join us as we embark on an exciting journey through the past, present, and future of gaming. From virtual reality to augmented reality, cloud gaming to artificial intelligence, we'll tackle it all and share our predictions and expectations for the future of the gaming landscape.

So, grab your controllers, put on your headsets, and tune in to "The Its Doh Show" for an engaging and entertaining exploration of the gaming universe. Get ready for thought-provoking discussions, hilarious stories, and an immersive experience that all gamers can relate to.

Subscribe now and never miss an episode of "The Its Doh Show" as we bring you the latest gaming insights, news, and adventures straight to your headphones. Let's level up together!

title: "Gamer's Haven: Unleashing Shadows in Shadow Fight 3"
description:
Step into the captivating world of the podcast "Shadow Unleashed," where we immerse ourselves in the realm of Shadow Fight 3, a sensational RPG fighting game that has enthralled gamers across the globe.

In this podcast episode, we embark on an exhilarating journey through the universe of Shadow Fight 3. Join us as we dissect the game's mechanics, uncover its captivating storyline, and delve into the strategic nuances that set it apart in the world of virtual combat.

Our hosts take you through the heart-pounding battles against both AI opponents and fellow players. As you venture further into the game, you'll discover new missions and quests that will sharpen your warrior skills and prepare you for high-stakes battles that demand your utmost prowess.

Listeners will be captivated by the sheer variety of gameplay modes, from single-player quests to the thrill of multiplayer battles alongside friends. Our discussion highlights the impressive graphics, sound design, and the meticulously crafted visuals that breathe life into every character and weapon.

As the podcast unfolds, you'll gain insight into the gameplay mechanics that allow you to customize your warrior, choose your weapons, and develop your combat strategy. The podcast team offers valuable tips on how to excel in battles and progress through the game's challenges.

"Shadow Unleashed" also delves into the game's diversity, offering a range of weapons, armor, and equipment to suit various playstyles. The hosts discuss the significance of upgrading your gear and selecting the right tools for each encounter.

Throughout the episode, you'll be treated to an in-depth review that explores the game's strengths and occasional drawbacks. The hosts share their thoughts on the game's unique features, its fluid combat system, and the thrill of facing off against powerful adversaries in a dynamic and visually stunning environment.

As the episode concludes, the podcast team recommends other engaging RPG titles for those seeking more immersive gaming experiences, ensuring you'll always have exciting adventures to look forward to.

Tune in to "Shadow Unleashed" for a comprehensive exploration of the captivating world of Shadow Fight 3. Whether you're a seasoned fighter or new to the genre, this podcast promises to be your guide to mastering combat, embracing strategy, and unleashing the shadows within.

Why We Roll is fun and practical in tone, combining the benefits of a shoot-the-shit professional chat with an advice show, and including some actual-play segments. Chris and Wythe take a sensitive, curious, ecumenical approach to game design, and their perspectives are informed by years of work on their own games. Between conversations, Chris and Wythe work through specific problems in the course of playing new games, often with one of the games’ designers.

On the show, Chris and Wythe speak to a roster of different TTRPG designers, with a focus on professional and professionalizing indie designers who share a broadly Leftist ideological bent. (“Designers” includes writers, artists, graphic and layout artists, voice talent, and many others, but most guests have a strong hand in mechanical game-design per se.)

Through the show, Chris and Wythe hope to amplify new creative voices, connect with leading indie designers, and work through a range of mechanical and narrative questions that are pertinent to many designers, players, and GMs.

Why We Roll is both entertainment and resource, part of a longstanding tradition of “showing our homework” in the indie TTRPG community as well as a showcase of fresh, new, and even challenging ideas about what makes imagination-based games so powerful.

title: Backyard Bards
description: Backyard Bards is a TTRPG actual-play podcast. Join us as we explore a variety of worlds and systems, swapping tall tales around a fire.

title: ProGamer
description: Los videojuegos son más que un simple pasatiempo; es un mundo dinámico e inmersivo donde los jugadores se convierten en héroes, estrategas y exploradores. En este reino digital, la creatividad no conoce límites y las aventuras virtuales esperan en cada esquina. Ya sea combatiendo criaturas míticas en épicas RPGs, poniendo a prueba tus reflejos en emocionantes shooters o resolviendo intrincados rompecabezas en aventuras que desafían tu mente, los videojuegos ofrecen una escapada hacia la imaginación sin límites. Es una comunidad diversa donde se forjan amistades, las competiciones son intensas
